description: Genericization of Granola, name of an early brand of the cereal, itself a variation of Granula, invented by James Caleb Jackson in 1863. Granula was named after the granules of Graham flour, the main ingredient.

adjectives.description: granola (comparative more granola, superlative most granola)

entries.meaning: (chiefly Canada, US, of a person) Eating healthy food, supporting the protection of the environment, and having liberal views.
examples: You see more and more of the granola hippie activist types these days.

entries.meaning: A breakfast and snack food consisting of loose, crispy pellets made of nuts, rolled oats, honey and other natural ingredients.
